private_information: I can drive between places; driving duration = distance(from,to) / speed(truck0)
While driving I am not at any place
truck0.goal: Transport crates as needed to achieve the global stacking goals under coordination.

private_information: I can drive between places; driving duration = distance(from,to) / speed(truck1)
While driving I am not at any place
truck1.goal: Transport crates as needed to achieve the global stacking goals under coordination.

private_information: I can lift, putdown, load into truck, unload from truck
Lift and putdown actions last 1 time unit
hoist0.goal: Manipulate crates at my current place to enable the global stacking goals under coordination.

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that models the trucks, hoists, crates, places, durations, and the stacking goal minimizing total-time.

public_information: Trucks move between places with duration = distance/place / speed(truck)
Hoists manipulate crates at their place; lifting/putdown last 1 time unit
Crates can be on pallets or other crates; pallets are surfaces
Trucks and hoists are the only movers; hoists do all pick/place operations

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent temporal PDDL problems. You will be provided information about the environment and capabilities/constraints of trucks and hoists. Produce a PDDL domain and problem that captures objects, places, at/on/in relations, clear/available/lifting fluents, durations using numeric fluents (distance, speed, weight, power), and actions for drive, hoist-lift, hoist-putdown, hoist-load, hoist-unload. Ensure actions respect start/over all/end conditions and effects and make agent-specific actions distinct (truck actions vs hoist actions). Optimize total-time.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The trucks' constraints and speeds are: {environment->init->truck_speeds}.
The hoists' constraints and powers are: {environment->init->hoist_power}.
The crates' weights are: {environment->init->crate_weights}.
The distance table is: {environment->init->distances}.
The hoists' initial availability is: {environment->init->available_hoists}.
Think step by step and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model the temporal, numeric and structural aspects described. Do not assume facts beyond the provided initial state. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
